title: Intermittent Test: BeaconBlocksByRangeIntegrationTest
body:
### Description
From https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/ConsenSys/teku/10329/workflows/f53e85db-5689-423d-9939-9d409389dd4c/jobs/65232

```

```

I ran this test 2000 times without failure locally.  I think we can expect some low level of intermittency for integration tests that set up actual network connections.  Probably not worth digging into given that the failure is very difficult to reproduce.
Reproduced it once locally. Another test failed together with this #3669 which probably has a better clue to the reason

https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/blob/cc98b7230126985e92f3ed4136e6012a74e762a5/networking/p2p/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/networking/p2p/libp2p/rpc/RpcHandler.java#L75-L76

The exception is thrown from `createStream()` method.

The `createStream()` is called when the `Connection` was just closed but when passing `SafeFuture.notInterrupted(closeInterruptor)` the `Connection.closeFuture` was not yet complete
The test failure #3669 looks unrelated to this one
